name: Semiconductor - Modern
description: Sector template for modern semiconductor device patents using H10 classification (post-2023 reorganization).
contextDescription: Modern semiconductor patents use the H10 CPC classification introduced in 2023 to reorganize semiconductor device patents. Key areas include H10B (memory devices), H10D (semiconductor devices), H10F (radiation-sensitive devices), H10K (organic electronics), and H10N (electric solid-state devices). These patents cover the latest device innovations and manufacturing techniques.
scoringGuidance: H10B patents cover memory device structures (3D NAND, DRAM cells).
H10D patents cover transistor and device structures.
H10N patents cover thermoelectric and superconducting devices.
These modern classifications often represent recent innovations.
Consider overlap with traditional H01L classifications.

questions.question: How novel is the semiconductor device structure or architecture described?
questions.reasoningPrompt: Identify the device innovation and its advancement over prior art.

questions.question: Is this patent relevant to advanced process nodes (7nm and below)?
questions.reasoningPrompt: Advanced nodes command premium licensing. Assess node applicability.

questions.question: Does this patent relate to emerging memory technologies (3D NAND, MRAM, ReRAM)?
